page.title: 08Heddon Oak
page.content:
{ Heddon Oak }was 408 years old when one Sunday some men cut it down saying that it was rotten but when it was done there was nothing wrong with it,
Legend has that six{West Somerset} men who were {The Duke of Monmouths {men}and fugitives from the battle at Sedgemoor were hanged at {Heddon Oak. {After hanging}they were tarred and quartered in the field above {Heddon {Oak,}this is known as {Blood Field. { { Heddon Oak}has an uncanny reputation. It is said that chains can be heard clinking and then sounds of horses being galloped nearer but no horses ever arrive. { }
